page.title: 03TRANSPORT AROUND THE AREA
page.content: AS GREAT BENTLEY IS A RURAL COMMUNITY, HALF WAY BETWEEN COLCHESTER AND CLACTON, EACH A TEN MILE JOURNEY, TRANSPORT IS OF VITAL IMPORTANCE. THE MOST IMPORTANT OF ALL MEANS OF TRANSPORT IS PRIVATE CAR. ROADS IN THE AREA ARE QUITE GOOD AND CAR ESSENTIAL FOR SOCIAL AND BUSINESS USE.THE SMALL VILLAGES AROUND GREAT BENTLEY ARE PARTICULARLY DEPENDENT ON CARS FOR ALL TRANSPORT. THE AREA IS QUITE FLAT AND CYCLING IS STILL A POPULAR AND USEFUL METHOD OF TRANSPORT. BUS SERVICES ARE SEVERELY RESTRICTED, EXCEPT BETWEEN COLCHESTER AND CLACTON, WITH INDIVIDUAL VILLAGES HAVING A LIMITED SERVICE. GREAT BENTLEY IS ON THE MAIN EAST COAST RAIL LINE, WITH ITS OWN STATION PROVIDING A SERVICE DIRECT TO LONDON, STOPPING AT COLCHESTER.
